meanings.definition: A hand in bridge or whist containing no card above a nine.
meanings.sent1: During the card game, I was surprised to receive a yarboroughs hand with no high cards.
meanings.sent2: In bridge, getting a yarboroughs hand is extremely rare and usually leads to losing the game.
meanings.sent3: At the card table, Bob joked that his yarboroughs hand was so bad, it must have been cursed.
meanings.sent4: Her yarboroughs hand felt like a collection of forgotten cards, lost in a sea of higher values.
meanings.sent5: The yarboroughs hand was like a lonely island in a sea of powerful cards, isolated and weak.

meanings.definition: A hand in bridge or whist containing no card above a nine.
meanings.sent1: During the card game, she couldn't believe her luck when she got a yarboroughs hand.
meanings.sent2: The yarboroughs hand he held made it challenging to win any tricks in the game.
meanings.sent3: When Tom saw his yarboroughs hand, he pretended to faint dramatically, causing laughter at the table.
meanings.sent4: The yarboroughs hand felt like a forgotten corner of the deck, hidden from the spotlight of high cards.
meanings.sent5: In the game, the yarboroughs hand stood out like a lone tree in a forest of powerful cards, struggling to compete.
